quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man’s character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God’s side, for God is always right.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I will prepare and someday my chance will come.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I don’t like that man. I must get to know him better.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren’t very new after all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I am in favor of animal rights as well as human rights. That is the way of a whole human being.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Tact is the ability to describe others as they see themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The better part of one’s life consists of his friendships.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: You cannot build character and courage by taking away a man’s initiative and independence.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Don’t worry when you are not recognized, but strive to be worthy of recognition.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
author: Abraham Lincoln
